text: 'Reasonably priced delicious pies and if you order ahead they always have it ready for you so you don‚Äôt have to wait long.'

author: Jessica Milton
text: 'I can‚Äôt tell you how the pizza is because I never got it. I called this place and ordered an hour ahead to give myself a decent cushion of time. I show up when the pizza is supposed to be ready and I wait.. and wait.. and wait. I‚Äôm a patient person and I could see the poor kid was stressed so I tried to be cool about it. But after an hour waiting (past the time the pizza was supposed to be ready) I simply asked for my money back. At which point the owner told the cooks he didn‚Äôt need it so they stopped making it. Why they were just making it then is beyond me.\n\nThere were a few others ahead of me who were also upset because their orders got lost
column5: were done incorrectly
column6: or were waiting excessively. I get it
column7: you‚Äôre slammed. So don‚Äôt tell people to come in 40 minutes maybe? I had my 1 year old exhausted and hungry in the car. Now I have a tired baby and no dinner. Extremely disappointing.'

I will be back to try Napolis again and I highly recommend stopping in to check them out!

Also

author: followJTusa JT USA
text: "Review posted October 7
column5: 2020. Hoboken
column6: USA. Napoli's: This place is no good for indoor dining: delivery people pick up at the dining area and the comings-and-goings indoors ruined my reunion with a friend who came all the way from Brooklyn. As for the food
column7: I ordered Eggplant Parm with Spaghetti and my guest ordered Chicken with Spaghetti. A big mistake  because the overcooked spaghetti was soggy; the sauce was watery; and the whole dish was served barely above room temperature! The eggplants tasted ok but were ok but were also not hot enough. My guest could not contain her disappoinment. Even the olive oil for dipping was a letdown. The only good point was the bread that nicely sliced and oven-warmed. Moreover
column8: we did not not get any Parmegiano-Reggiano served with our spaghetti. (Who does that?!? I mean
column9: not care about the food they serve)! In the meantime
column10: there was so much noise coming from the kitchen. As for masks worn by workers at the pizza oven? That's another story _ not to mention a bunch of pizza boxes that fell to the floor that were re-stacked with the rest of the clean boxes!\nI was beyond embarrassed to have invited my friend to try Napoli's
column11: a pizzeria/restaurant  I hand't been to in years. The lady I later called at Napoli's sounded disinterested and angry
column12: not at all interested with my feedback. As an excuse
column13: she just cited her issues! (I guess I will not be too adventurous next time and will stay close to our tried-and-true Hoboken Italian faves
column14: the majority of which are mostly downtown to midtown). Sorry
column16: my friend from Brooklyn. I was going to impress you with Hoboken Italian. Next time
column17: we'll go to our trusted Italian places in Hoboken. (I miss Tutta Pasta!!! Where are you

author: Katherine Kaplan
text: 'The worst pizza I have had in Hoboken. Sat down and ordered 2 slices of pizza to dine in midday. (Clearly a mistake
column5: since someone came up to us acting like a waiter
column6: yet another couple of people ordered their pizza inside to-go
column7: then ate out of their to-go box at a table across from us without issue as if it was a fast food place.) Both of the slices were terrible
column8: the dough for both was dry like a cracker and very hard to chew
column9: seemed like they took two very old slices of pizza and reheated them. The toppings on the second slice were fresh and the only part I enjoyed.'

author: Ruben Sanrelus
text: 'Where do I start? It took quite awhile for my lady and I to be acknowledged when we arrived here. There was no sign mentioning self seating and the waiter seemed to be engaged in a conversation with no regard to the fact that there were people waiting at the entrance. We went inside to speak to someone about seating and the gentleman said we would receive help from the waiter outside. We go back outside and the waiter looks at us and then goes inside. Then he came out and finally acknowledged us and said we can seat ourselves. That took way too long. Then the waiter takes our order of a calamari appetizer and a large pizza. After we finish our calamari
column5: a woman brings out our pizza on a metal plate and stand. The pizza was clearly too big for their small tables
column6: but she tried to fit this pizza onto our table regardless and while trying to move a glass
column7: this scorching hot pizza slid towards my lady‚Äôs chest in which she blocked with her hand and ended up suffering from a severe burn on her hand and a glass fell off the table and spilled over me. The girl seemed remorseful initially
column8: but she never came to check on us again for the rest of our time there. After this incident
column9: another table was brought out to us for the pizza to sit on. Once again it‚Äôs a large pizza on a stand. I slide out one slice of pizza
column10: this threw off the balance of the metal plate and the rest of the pizza slid off onto the floor. The waiter says don‚Äôt worry I‚Äôll get you guys another one
column11: but it was as if he assumed the pizza falling onto the ground was my fault. This incident was bound to happen again because they were prepared to use that same useless stand again and I had to ask him to remove the stand and just provide the pizza on the silver plate. All this happened and no manager ever came up to us to discuss what happened. No one cares that a customer had been burned by an employee. Worst customer service experience ever.'

text: "Couldn't get through either the Holland or Lincoln tunnels last night and with Siriously Sintra tuned in
column5: we decided to go to Hoboken for pizza. Got a space in front of Napoli
column6: but that's the only good new. What a disappointment. The crust on both the margarita pie and the classic NY pie and on every pie being set on other tables were severly over-cooked. Ours didn't have any bread- like qualities like an ingredient was missing. No way to fold a slice without snapping it in your hand. The NY pie was molten orange with nothing resembling red sauce or real mozzarella. The margherita had some red sauce and had white mozzarella circles
column7: but they were scorched too and there was very little flavor. Have to say that the servers were great. The place was doing a strong take out and delivery business and there were plenty of diners. I just can't figure why. GM"

author: Tim
text: "The place was nice
column5: could use some finishing inside or updating. Besides that the service was great and fast! The pizza was amazing and would definitely recommend. I could eat this every day! There small pizza isn't so small
column6: which isn't a bad thing and it was reasonably priced."

author: Kim Payton
text: 'It was perfect. So fresh and baked in a brick oven. Service was awesome'

author: Matt
text: 'Have ordered from this place easily 25+ times.  Past two orders the garlic knots have had a long black hair in them.  Calling the restaurant for a refund resulted in them asking for a picture and getting nowhere as "the manager had just stepped out."  Horrible customer service.  Will not order from again.'

author: Hugh Nealy
text: "Out of the park pizza and hero sandwiches.  One of the best slices of pizza I've had in a long time.  Crust is thin and crispy.  I am not exaggerating about this New York style pizza."

author: Jubran Sawaged
text: 'Amazing Pizza'

author: Mehul Gupta
text: 'Really nice place in Hoboken New Jersey. Perfect for a after college party with friends. It has some of the best brick oven new york style pizzas
column5: the best pasta I have ever had. The place has a rustic feel and the best part is its BYOB. I totally recommend having the penne pasta and pesto pasta. They are so delicious that just writing this review makes me feel hungry again.  Nice place for a weekend party with friends.'

author: Abderrahim Rhazi
text: 'Nice and good pizza'

author: tsh
text: 'So we ordered a pizza from here. First
column5: the email stated an hour until delivery but showed up in about 20 minutes...to which it arrived cold and the wrong order. We got a large pepperoni and sausage
column6: got only a large COLD sausage with half the cheese gone..also looks like the guy dropped it. They are already closed aka not taking calls and no way to contact on site so I guess this is the only way to complain. I ate half a piece and pitched it. Both myself and boyfriend felt sick shortly after eating the minimum that we did. Definitely contacted my credit card company already'

author: Rajanish Pandey
text: 'Used to be a great place and we came here almost every week for 10 years. The new server is so obnoxious that today was the last time. For someone who used to be huge fan
column5: telling people this is best pizza on this side of atlantic...it takes a lot to be so frustrated.\n\nFrank (owner) connected after the incident and explained that incident was due to a music event that server was organizing leading to unavailability of certain tables we requesting. Revert to 5 star rating.'

author: Kalarav Vasavada
text: 'In pizza Chesse quality was not upto mark.. taste was ok..Garlic bread was tasty though'

author: Gabi
text: 'The pizza is really good. But the oldest server makes me feel really uncomfortable. The girls are lovely and the youngest male server is a sweetie.  But the one male server looked at my ENTIRE BODY happily without shame then looked me in the eyes. He also kept staring at me while I waited.  Creeped me out
column5: I don‚Äôt go in when he is there.'

author: Jason Kealy
text: "Best damn pizza in Hoboken. Disagree? Let's fight about it."

author: Aaron Burman
text: "Tourist-friendly staff with a great (but not overly extensive) selection of true New York style pizzas. A must-see place if you're staying in Hoboken or Weehawken."

author: Robert Frusina
text: 'Pretty good penne vodka. Decent pizza
column5: and good service. Over all a solid italian kitchen'

author: Mark Henry
text: 'Food was excellent'

author: ADVERSARY NEMESIS
text: "Personally
column5: I love it! Seriously
column6: BEST PLACE IN HOBOKEN! Their food is amazing and the staff is great! I highly recommend Napoli's!"

author: Amir Choudhury
text: 'The buffalo chicken pizza was fantastic and our waiter gave us free zeppoles.'

author: Matthew Bombard
text: 'The best buffalo chicken pizza in the US. Hands down.'

author: Nick R.
text: "Great pies
column5: gotta love the brick oven style.  Crispy crust and decent toppings. Gotta say
column6: haven't been there in a while and a bit underwhelmed that don't spice up their pizza selection w some more unique offerings.\nSo I decided to create my own
column7: white pizza w arugula and prosciutto. Delicious!!  Also
column8: all their servers were new and knew nothing about the menu items.  Not a bad thing
column9: albeit concerning from a turnover stand point
column10: but they were all very nice and tending.  BYOB- so plan ahead!  Fyi- Wine store next door was closed for aparent summer updates"

author: William Whelan
text: 'Nice wood fired gas oven. Pizza is made to order. Large small or personal. Cheese steak pizza is delicious . Lunch time was busy . and as a result service was slow.'

author: Brenda Tirado
text: 'We would like extend a BIGGGGGG THANK YOU to Napolis for catering at our beautiful baby shower this past Saturday. EVERYTHING was absolutely delicious! Completely recommend this restaurant for regular dining & your private events! Thank you !\n- Tirado Fam üòò'

author: Noel Colon
text: 'Excellent food and service. Pizza was nice and thin..'

author: Ivan villaplana
text: 'Great food great service'

author: Nick Martella
text: 'Very good pizza. Wish they had a bigger selection available for immediate pickup.'

author: J.T. Doscher
text: 'Good late night eats'

author: Rick Modrzewski
text: 'Legit food'

author: Dimitri Leles
text: 'I just had to deal with a completely incompetent individual. The ‚Äúowners friend‚Äù watching the place. A complete imbecile.  Over 2 hour wait for the food to arrive he lies to me and tells me he called and left a message.  Time and time again this place is a problem and it comes down to a terrible operator. Theyre incapable of taking a and delivering a pizza order.\n\nNo your manager was not cOrrect. First of all. I gave your delivery driver the cash 2 years ago and he told me no the order is paid for.  Afterwards I received 10 calls and text message past 11pm at night.  Your staff was texting me from their personal cell phones telling me the driver was going to be fired.  This was your mistake. Not mine.  Secondly. I spoke to someone and took care of this. I placed an order and gave the driver $20 additional to square away this mistake.  Thirdly. Your manager did not call or even mention anything. He let me wait for my food loft 2 hours.  So no I do not want to speak to you. This is a joke and so is your restaurant.  You need to train your drivers better and your staff because they‚Äôre competent icomprtent.'

author: Sarvesh Shah
text: 'My favorite takeout pizza place in Hoboken! Their Vodka pie is the best.'

author: Emily Raque
text: 'They have the best specialty pizza toppings! Would recommend the Buffalo chicken pizza'

author: Nicholas DiMaria
text: 'Great place to go grab a slice or to even for a nice dinner. Service was decent not excellent. They had a  guitar player which was nice just playing some relaxing tunes.'

author: adina rajesh
text: 'When I last visited there we ordered pasta with spinach and shrimp pasta. The pasta is not cooked and they served it. My friend is a regular customer to your place. She don‚Äôt get the taste as it is everyday. I don‚Äôt know the reason why they give me uncooked pasta. Rest of them everything is good.'

author: Sebastian hampel
text: 'Super great service had a great time!!!!'

author: Andy Lee
text: "Haven't tried too many pizza places around Hoboken yet
column5: but this place has great pizzas.  They have lunch specials every day from 12-4
column6: $5 for 2 slices of plain or margarita with a fountain drink or $7 for 2 slices of anything else with a fountain drink.  My favorite here so far is the eggplant parm!"

author: Hailey Kellstrom
text: 'Called in an order for pickup
column5: and received attitude over the phone. Proceeded to wait 40 minutes for my food
column6: and get food poisoning after the fact.'

author: Uzair Kaludi
text: 'Very nice food
column5: owner is very friendly too. They have seating out side except winter which is fun.'

author: Kurtis B
text: 'Margherita pizza is fresh and delicious üçï'

author: Paarth Purohit
text: 'Had good pizza with vegetarian and non-vegetarian options. Quick service and the staff was friendly.'

author: Susan Raynes
text: "Always friendly; down to earth staff. Work as quickly as they can when it gets slammed. Eager to accommodate. They even make gluten free pizza and it's tasty!! Thank you!! üíõ"

author: Matt Meany
text: 'Pizza is good. It is bring your own alcohol which is different. Has a nice area outside on the sidewalk.'

author: Pratik Tambe
text: 'Its BYOB! AWESOME pizza
column5: amazing appetizer! Super friendly staff.'

author: Majid R. Goldyani
text: 'Cozy and Good pizza.'

author: Jigz
text: 'Awesome pizzas. Delicious sauces. Quality food. Excellent Friendly servers. Great dinner experience with my family and friends'

author: Zach
text: 'Fantastic pizza. They‚Äôre a little light on pepperonis when you order
column5: so I always order double pepperoni
column6: still a great place.'

author: CBS Limo
text: '2nd to none  gotta try this place'

author: galaxy note 3
text: "The best napoli sliders and pizza I've ever had! No lie
column5: if u don't like it send it to me I'll eat it! Lol"

author: Itai Schadmi
text: 'Went for pizza with the family for lunch
column5: service was great and the food was delicious.'

author: bob grose
text: 'Great food'

author: Caroline Panagacos
text: 'Love their whole wheat pies!'

author: Michael T
text: 'We order from here almost every weekend and it has been going down hill the past few weeks.  We just ordered eggplant rollatini and a large pizza.  The rollatini was one small piece (for $10) and it wasn‚Äôt even edible.  Was rubber and had to be thrown away.  The pizza we asked for it to be not well done and it came extra crispy.  We hope they get better but it doesn‚Äôt appear that way based off our last few orders.'

author: Bresiamoa
text: "There are also no rules about the kinds of toppings you put on your pizza. Choose ones you love. They will cook a little in the oven
column5: but if it isn't something you like to eat raw
column6: like sausage or mushrooms
column7: allow some time to cook them ahead of time. If you'd like fresh greens
column10: sprinkle them over the pizza right when it comes out of the oven. The residual heat from the pizza will wilt the greens just slightly and bring out their flavor.\n\nIt's best
column12: to keep the toppings to just a handful at most. If you load homemade pizza down with a ton of toppings
column13:
it may take too long for the crust to cook well.

Pile on the cheese or keep it all veg for a healthier midweek meal; it's all up to you. Play around with this basic recipe and make it your own.

Napoli's pizza is the best in town and i am always glad they fufill my order in a toast and timely manner."

author: Dawn G
text: 'Nice outdoor cafe seating under canopy with great views of street.  Lovingly prepared home made pizza with quality ingredients. Great wait staff.  Timely takeout service. ‚ô°'

author: Pearl Stars
text: "Delicious pizza. The sauce is perfect. I go for the sauce. I'm so happy that they are in town."

author: Dmitriy Zemel
text: "After multiple calls and 3 hours of waiting
column5: order was never received. Hope they don't mess up yours!"

author: chris kay
text: 'Pizza is average food below avg .service not nearly as good as it used to be ..maybe they r too busy with deliveries .'

author: Johnny Nicol
text: 'Awful food and awful service. We placed an order for delivery (we live across the street). We waited 25 minutes
column5: decided to call to pick it up. They tell us it‚Äôs out for delivery. We waited another 25 minutes (even though we live across the street). We finally get the food after calling to complain and not only is it cold
column6: but they literally served us a bread sandwich. Nothing in the sandwich but bread
column7: literally just bread. We paid $25 for awful food
column9: and waited over an hour to eat just a bread sandwich. I don‚Äôt ever leave reviews - but this place is literally filled with inept people
column10: it‚Äôs unbelievable. You better believe I called my credit card company. How the hell is this place in business???'

author: Jacqueline Silva
text: 'I love their meatlovers pizza... and I eat vegetarian food most of the time!'

author: Glenn Coogan
text: 'No matter what you choose to eat
column5: you will appreciate the meal'

author: Moudy Eskandr
text: 'The most tasty pizza i have ever eaten'
